page.title: 15The annual carnival.
page.content: Loughor carnival started in 1965,it celebrated its'twentieth birthday this year.The carnival is organised by the local churches and the proceeds are shared equally between St Pauls,St Davids and St Michaels.It is always held on the first Saturday in June.One of the most important jobs is to choose the carnival queens.They do this by holding two dances in the village,the first to choose the Fairy Queen and the second to choose the Rose Queen,they also choose six attendants for each Queen. On the day of the carnival the floats move in a planned route and then return to the grounds were the Queens are crowned.After counting the money an equal amount is shared between the churches that arranged the carnival.Carnival day is one of the best days of the year in our area.
